treatment.discussion: The relationships of Carex sect. Firmiculmes are unclear. The absence of bracts and presence of foliaceous pistillate scales are reminiscent of sect. Phyllostachyae Tuckerman ex Kükenthal. The groups differ in numerous other characters. The presence of rachillae suggests that the section is primitive; its phylogenetic position remains unresolved.

key_statement.statement: Plants not cespitose, short to long rhizomatous; culms triangular, scabrous distally; leaves plane, 1.1 – 3.5 mm wide, equaling or exceeding culms; perigynia with 2 strong marginal veins, otherwise veinless.
Rhizomes prolonged; pistillate portions of spike unbranched; proximal pistillate scales
Rhizomes very short; pistillate portions of spike 0 – 2 branched; proximal pistillate scales
